name: Grand Canyon
hint: Immense gorge carved by the Colorado River in Arizona

name: Great Plains
hint: Vast expanse of flat grassland across the central United States and Canada

name: Rocky Mountains
hint: Major mountain range stretching from Canada to New Mexico

name: Appalachian Mountains
hint: Ancient eastern mountain range stretching from Alabama to Newfoundland

name: Everglades
hint: Tropical wetland ecosystem in southern Florida, river of grass

name: Mojave Desert
hint: Arid desert in southeastern California, home to Joshua trees

name: Great Basin
hint: Largest area of contiguous endorheic watersheds in North America

name: Canadian Shield
hint: Large area of exposed Precambrian rock covering much of eastern Canada

name: Death Valley
hint: Hottest place on Earth, lowest point in North America, in California

name: Niagara Falls
hint: Famous waterfalls on the US-Canada border between Lakes Erie and Ontario

name: Panama Canal
hint: Artificial waterway connecting the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans across Central America

name: Yucatan Peninsula
hint: Limestone peninsula in Mexico known for Mayan ruins and cenotes

name: Gulf of Mexico
hint: Large ocean basin bordered by the US, Mexico, and Cuba

name: Chesapeake Bay
hint: Largest estuary in the US, surrounded by Maryland and Virginia, famous for blue crabs

name: Bay of Fundy
hint: Bay between New Brunswick and Nova Scotia with the highest tides in the world

name: Hudson Bay
hint: Large body of saltwater in northeastern Canada, named after explorer Henry Hudson

name: Baja California Peninsula
hint: Long narrow peninsula in northwestern Mexico separating the Pacific from the Sea of Cortez

name: Mississippi Delta
hint: River delta in Louisiana where the Mississippi empties into the Gulf of Mexico

name: Strait of Florida
hint: Ocean strait between Florida and Cuba, carrying the Gulf Stream northward

name: Copper Canyon
hint: System of canyons in Mexico larger and deeper than the Grand Canyon in the Sierra Madre
